hero.title: AG1: how to increase the average check in Health Nutririon by subscription

items.value: Brand and website updates, advertising landing page builder, personal account on Shopify, CRM, order management admin panel, 3 design systems
items.label: what I did

items.value: Shopify, Figma, Design systems, Autolayouts, Tokens, Variables, iOS guidelines, Animations, A/B testing, Edge cases
items.label: stack

sections.text: AG1 is a daily package of nutrients in a subscription format. Once a month, a person receives a kit that covers basic needs for vitamins, minerals, and adaptogens. No complicated schemes: one product, a simple ritual and a stable result.

Subscription is the heart of the business. To make it work better, it is important to conveniently change the order, subscription settings, control deliveries and understand the benefits. My goal is to simplify these processes, make the funnel and interface efficient, and at the same time increase the average receipt and LTV.

blocks.text:
AG1 grew, but faced a typical problem with subscription services: users rarely changed their plan, did not purchase additional products, and hardly interacted with their personal account.

The reasons were simple: the necessary functions were deeply hidden, the benefits between the plans were not obvious, and the interface did not help to make a decision. As a result, the average receipt for a repeat purchase remained noticeably lower than expected.

The main tasks that I have undertaken:

- increase the average repeat purchase receipt (target — +18.2%)
- increase LTV (target — +6.2%)
- simplify the subscription management path.

Do all this carefully, without aggressive pressure on the user.

blocks.subtitle: Figured out how people behave in the product
blocks.text: I analyzed clicks, scrolls, and scripts. I found out where users are slowing down, what they don't find, and which options they ignore altogether.

blocks.subtitle: Rebuilt the structure of the subscription page
blocks.text: I made variants of the plan and an addendum. the products are more visible. Highlighted the economy and the logic of choice. Reduced the number of steps and made the process visually clearer.

blocks.subtitle: Added a gentle and honest upsell
blocks.text:
Not "buy more!" but calm hints:

— show the benefit when choosing 2 packs instead of 1
— offer travel-packs as an additional product
— explain the difference between the options.

Hints appeared only where they really helped the user make a decision.

blocks.subtitle: Updated my personal account and the admin area
blocks.text:
Simplified scenarios for changing the delivery date, number of packages, and order composition.
Made product cards and modal windows more understandable.

blocks.subtitle: Tested hypotheses
blocks.text: We launched A/B tests, collected data, and finalized text prompts, buttons, and visual accents.

+18.2% to the average repeat purchase receipt.
+6.2% to LTV due to improved subscription performance.
People began to actively change the plan and add products.
There are fewer support questions, and the interface has become simpler and clearer.
My personal account has come to life: The activity increased by about 1.7 times.

blocks.quote: “We have an amazing design system now”
blocks.author: Nick Boes, deisgn director AG1
